txt.en: Instance: Shattered Roots
'I have learned a great many things from the trees, [placeholder]...'
'Many things were as I feared, and some were far worse yet.'
'We made it, boys!'
'I have much to tell, and little time to tell it, so let us begin!'
'You lot, get in there and hack it down before I crush your skulls myself!'
'You don't have to tell me twice! On my way!'
'What?! This is no tree!'
'Is... is it dead?'
'The Wizard won't like this...'
'What are you waiting for, fools?! Attack!'
'How shall I tell him a tree devastated his forces?'
'Ha! You are a wise Orc! I shall tell him my forces remain here with me...'
'And you... you will return to Isengard with the tree!'
'Many of our number still stand, but so many have fallen, and for what?'
'We're close enough to the forest's edge now. We make camp here...'
'...once we cut one more tree down for the Wizard.'
'You, make the first cut! We have to cart this back to Isengard soon or Saruman will have my head!'
'TBD Outro'
'Who says you have to tell the Wizard?'
'Deep in these woods, there once lived a great Huorn called Brúndoron...'
'A more well-behaved Huorn than most, Leaflock's tending was never much needed, and its roots grew thick into the heart of the forest.'
'Brúndoron took root, unbothered by the affairs of Ents or Men, but the pursuits of the Orcs were not so easily ignored...'
'And so came the day that the Orcs invaded, defiling the forest and preparing to siege the lands of Men...'
'Run back and tell the others to get over here! We'll be needin' more!'
'Brúndoron had long lain dormant, but that time had come to an end.'
'Get off! Get off! Ahhh...'
